text.p: The following are some leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- Socialist party leader in parliament Jorge Lacao may resign over criticism of his handling of negotiations with the opposition on constitutional reform.
- Banco Mello exceeded its target, posting around half a billion escudo net consolidated profit last year, chairman Francisco Lacerda said.
- President Jorge Sampaio wants quarterly reports from Macau governor Rocha Vieira on state of transition to Chinese rule.
- Tax revenues in first two months were 42 billion escudos more than forecast, according to senior aid to Prime Minister Antonio Guterres.
- Portugal and France want to promote partnerships between their businessmen interested in developing markets in Africa and Latin America, Guterres says during visit to Paris.
- Tetra Pak will close production unit in Lisbon by the end of 1997.
